Trails.Name: Lost in the Woods (Lower) Uphill Route
Lost in the Woods (Upper) Uphill Route

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Saturday, February 21, 2026 8:45AM We currently have 18 lifts spinning at all our base lodges. Our teams are working to expand terrain and expect the mountain to be in full operation as the day progresses, conditions permitting. Will the top pop today? Yes. Will it be at 8:30 or even 9:00AM? Very unlikely. Stay tuned today as we have more operational updates to share. We appreciate the continued patience - we're in the final stretch! 

Conditions and Visibility: Sunny skies and cold temps today. Temps up to the high 20s today feel much colder due to chills. Winds will pick up in the afternoon. 
Lift status: Lower lifts out of all base lodges are expected at 8:30AM. 24 total lifts are expected with delays likely as our teams continue to make progress on expanding terrain. Please review our updated storm cycle procedure, new this year.
Currently open: 18 lifts, conditions permitting.
Anticipated, but delayed for mitigation: Cloud Nine Express (9), Chair 12, Chair 13, Chair 14, Chair 23, and the Upper Panorama Gondola. 
Safety: Deep snow remains a serious factor. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real, so avoid tree wells and deep snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner, keep your group in sight, and stay alert for obstacles beneath new snowfall. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Chains or snow tires are currently required. Roads are currently snowy and icy. If driving, please drive with caution and allow extra space. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status on highway closures, especially if you are traveling from out of town.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport:
Deep Snow Safety: Stay within sight of your group, give trees plenty of space, and avoid riding solo. Obstacles may exist beneath new snow, so ski and ride with caution.
On-mountain emergency hotline: 760.934.0611
